common_names: Fugio Cent - CLUB RAYS, Concave Ends, UNITED STATES
distinguishing_features: Concave (curved inward) ends on club rays
Contains FUCIO misspelling variety in late die state
identification_keywords: club rays, concave ends, united states
coins.notes: Federal Contract Coinage - CLUB RAYS, Concave Ends, UNITED STATES. Newman marriages: 19-S, 20-T. First official U.S. cent authorized by Congress.
coins.obverse_description: Sundial with "FUGIO" above, club-shaped rays with concave ends, date "1787"
coins.reverse_description: 13 linked rings with "WE ARE ONE" in center, "UNITED STATES" around rim
coins.source_citation: PCGS Registry, Newman Die Marriage Catalog, APMEX Historical Guide

characteristics: Concave (curved inward) ends on club rays
Contains FUCIO misspelling variety in late die state
varieties.name: CLUB RAYS, Concave Ends, UNITED STATES

common_names: Fugio Cent - CLUB RAYS, Rounded Ends
distinguishing_features: Rounded ends on the club rays
coins.notes: Federal Contract Coinage - CLUB RAYS, Rounded Ends. Newman marriages: 17-Q, 18-R. First official U.S. cent authorized by Congress.
coins.obverse_description: Sundial with "FUGIO" above, club-shaped rays with rounded ends, date "1787"
coins.reverse_description: 13 linked rings with "WE ARE ONE" in center, "UNITED STATES" around rim
coins.source_citation: PCGS Registry, Newman Die Marriage Catalog, APMEX Historical Guide

characteristics: Rounded ends on the club rays
varieties.name: CLUB RAYS, Rounded Ends

coins.obverse_description: Liberty wearing Native American headdress facing left, 'LIBERTY' on headband, 'UNITED STATES OF AMERICA' around rim, date below
coins.reverse_description: Oak wreath with shield at top enclosing 'ONE CENT'

coins.reverse_description: Two wheat stalks flanking 'ONE CENT', 'E PLURIBUS UNUM' above, 'UNITED STATES OF AMERICA' below

coins.reverse_description: Union Shield with 13 vertical stripes, 'ONE CENT' below, 'UNITED STATES OF AMERICA' around, 'E PLURIBUS UNUM' on banner
